model

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Level
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EliminationLevel, LightningLevel, PuzzleLevel, ReleaseLevel

    public abstract class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to hold anything that all Levels have in common This includes: The Game board values Score milestones (1/2/3 stars) Number of special moves As well as some common behavior associated with these attributes
    Author:
    jesse

      • getBoard

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        the current score

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int score)
        set the current score. Most often used like setScore(getScore() + something);
        Parameters:
        score - The new score

      • useSpecial

        public void useSpecial(int type)
        By using a special move, the number of that special that you are allowed to used is decremented, call this method after applying a special move to do that decrement
        Parameters:
        type - the type of special used, either Level.SWAP, Level.REARRANGE, or Level.CLEAR

      • hasSpecial

        public boolean hasSpecial(int type)
        checks if the user has any specials of the given type remaining The type should be either Level.SWAP, Level.REARRANGE, or Level.CLEAR
        Parameters:
        type - The special type
        Returns:
        whether or not the user has any remaining

      • getNumSpecial

        public int getNumSpecial(int type)
        gets the number of specials of the given type remaining used by the gui to tell the user how many of each move type remain
        Parameters:
        type - the special type, Level.SWAP, etc
        Returns:
        the number remaining

      • getMilestones

        public int[] getMilestones()
        The scores at which 1/2/3 stars are earned
        Returns:
        an int array, [0] is the milestone for the fist star

      • react

        public void react(IMove move)
        After every move, the board settles the tiles. Depending on the Level type, it may override this in order to take care of level specific things
        Parameters:
        move - The move just applied to the board

      • getLevelState

        public LevelState getLevelState()
        Gets the LevelState that this level is using
        Returns:
        The levelState

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts the level. Sets the score to 0 Swaps out the board for a new one resets the number of all special moves Note: this will not affect the gui until lv.restart() is called

      • starsEarned

        public int starsEarned(int score)
        Given a score, returns an int 0..3 representing the number of stars that score will earn the player on this level
        Parameters:
        score - the score
        Returns:
        The number of stars that score earns

        public abstract boolean isFinished()
